The front desk people at this location were all amazing especially Michael he was always pleasant to talk with.  I feel terrible his is the only name I paid attention to.

The cleaning staff is a different story and I blame the supervisor the most.  We were in room 1906, we had a late checkout at 1:00pm.  When we brought the luggage carts up to load everything we still had an hour till checkout.  Well the supervisor assumed because he saw us with the carts we had left the room & told he cleaner.  So we were taking a nap before getting on a 22 hour train ride back to the east coast.  She knocked not only waking us back the knock but walked into the room too.  Thank goodness it wasn't one of the times my husband decided to strip down.

The room was small and made even smaller by all the luggage we had for the trip, see we had been in Chicago for 10 days total due to my husband's work convention.  They do not have chair height toilets which because of how small the bathroom was made it very difficult for me to get up.   

Then there was the laundry room.  It has one washer and dryer it was very clean & safe as you had to have your room key to get in.  The washer did a great job the dryer not so much.  After spending $ 13 dollars anything made of cotton was still wet & I had to hang in our already small over filled room.  I will say when I went to the front desk they did refund $10.

The location was very central to everything downtown by either walking or bus.

review_title: You can never go wrong with Hilton
review_content: We were able to check in early which was nice. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The fitted sheet did not fit the bed when they changed the sheets, so we used the flat sheet to lay on. I have no doubt if I would have said something they would have fixed it, but to me it was not that big of deal just odd. When we asked for extra towels and blanket they got it right away. I wished they had a menu showing what their restaurant offered. Continental breakfast was $9 or you could order what you wanted for a fee. We did not end up eating at the hotel, but it’s a nice option to have. The hotel was in a nice location to do many things. I would stay again.
I highly recommend!

We experienced friendly, accommodating staff on all shifts. It's a simple, clean hotel, with an unbeatable location. Dozens of nice restaurants within 5 block radius. Hop-on tour bus just around the corner. River Tour Boat docks about 2 blocks away. Walking distance to "The Bean," Miracle Mile, the "Chicago" sign and art museum. Great evening street vibe. Fridge, microwave, Keurig in the ample-sized room. We had neighboring guests on all sides, but couldn't hear them at all. (Quiet rooms.) A tiny bit of late night street noise seeping in, but since the hotel is on a side street, it was really not too bad. Not a great view from the room, but just enough to let you know you're in Chicago! We would definitely stay there again.
